attributes.action: Reduce the Interest Rate on Student loans
attributes.additional_details:
Only 2 years of graduates have left University since the introduction of the new fee structure. The SLC has a monopoly and graduates have no choice but use them.
From September 2017, the interest added each month to the average loan will be £223 and as most starting graduates earn £25000 they only pay back £30 per month (9% of income over £21000) so the debt grows each month by £193 !
 Students will vote to change this system, as more  graduate,they will become a powerful voice demand action.
attributes.background:
Due to soaring tuition fees, average graduate debt is £44,000
Also incurring a punitive rate of interest , 6.1%from September 2017 which is 24 times the Bank Base rate and double what their elders pay for unsecured bank loans
The government must retrospectively reduce  interest rate

rejection.details:
We're not sure what you would like the interest rate on student loans to be. 

You may wish to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/201652

Alternatively, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
